meanings.definition: A person or thing that reminds or helps one remember something.
meanings.sent1: My sister is like a helpful remembrancer, always reminding me of important tasks.
meanings.sent2: The sticky notes on my desk act as useful remembrancers for my daily to-do list.
meanings.sent3: The friendly parrot became the family's unofficial remembrancer, repeating important messages.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a constant remembrancer of the joy she brought into our lives.
meanings.sent5: The old clock on the wall served as a reliable remembrancer of the passage of time.

meanings.definition: An official who reminds people of important dates or events.
meanings.sent1: The town crier was the traditional remembrancer for announcing royal proclamations.
meanings.sent2: The calendar on the office wall is a helpful remembrancer for upcoming meetings.
meanings.sent3: The forgetful mayor appointed a town jester as the official remembrancer for important events.
meanings.sent4: The church bells served as a solemn remembrancer of the passing of each hour.
meanings.sent5: The museum guide acted as a knowledgeable remembrancer of historical facts and dates.

meanings.definition: A legal document that serves as a reminder or record of a debt or obligation.
meanings.sent1: The receipt from the store acted as a clear remembrancer of the purchase I made.
meanings.sent2: The contract served as a legal remembrancer of the terms agreed upon by both parties.
meanings.sent3: The old ticket stub became a sentimental remembrancer of the concert I attended.
meanings.sent4: The unpaid bill was a constant remembrancer of the financial obligation hanging over my head.
meanings.sent5: The handwritten note on the fridge served as a personal remembrancer of the groceries to buy.
